item.title: Mutual UFO Network
item.description:
Mutual UFO Network ðŸ”—

The Mutual UFO Network (MUFON) is a US-based non-profit organization dedicated to the scientific study of UFOs. Founded in 1969, it has grown to include over 4,000 members worldwide, with chapters and representatives in numerous countries and all 50 US states.

History ðŸ”—

Originally established as the Midwest UFO Network in Quincy, Illinois, on May 31, 1969, by Allen R. Utke, Walter H. Andrus, Jr., and John F. Schuessler, among others. Many early members were associated with the SKYLOOK newsletter and the Aerial Phenomena Research Organization (APRO). The organization expanded and was renamed the Mutual UFO Network in 1973. In July 2020, Executive Director Jan Harzan was arrested on charges of soliciting sex from a minor and was subsequently removed from his position.

Operation ðŸ”—

MUFON is headquartered in Cincinnati, Ohio, and has chapters in every U.S. state. It holds an annual international symposium and publishes the monthly MUFON UFO Journal. In 2015, MUFON founded Mutual UFO Network University, an unaccredited online institution that trains members to investigate UFO sightings. The network claims over 500 field investigators and specialized teams to investigate potential physical evidence of extraterrestrial craft. Volunteers are trained to interview witnesses, conduct research, and analyze evidence, requiring them to pass an exam and a background check. MUFON’s website features a newsroom and case management system.

Criticism ðŸ”—

Pseudoscience ðŸ”—

MUFON has faced criticism for its focus on pseudoscience. Critics argue that the organization’s conferences and publications delve into topics like alien abduction, conspiracy theories, human-ET hybrids, hypnotic regression, and repressed memories, which are considered unscientific. The qualifications of the amateur volunteers who examine UFO reports have also been questioned.

Officers and donors with far-right viewpoints ðŸ”—

In April 2018, Newsweek reported evidence of anti-immigrant, anti-trans, and anti-Muslim sentiments among MUFON officials and donors, including J. Z. Knight and former MUFON State Director for Pennsylvania John Ventre. These individuals have publicly expressed racist and/or anti-Semitic views. This led to resignations from MUFON, including former Director of Research Chris Cogswell and former board member and Washington State Director James Clarkson. Erica Lukes, former MUFON State Director for Utah, described MUFON as unwilling to adequately address sexual harassment. In 2020, Vice magazine reported that Ken Pfeifer, head of MUFON’s Rhode Island chapter, posted racist memes and comments on Facebook.

Popular culture ðŸ”—

MUFON has been mentioned in various television shows, including:

  • UFOs Over Earth (Discovery Channel)
  • UFO Hunters (History Channel)
  • The X-Files
  • Ancient Aliens (History Channel)
  • Hangar 1: The UFO Files
  • 9-1-1: Lone Star

It has also been mentioned in news articles in The New York Times and Forbes.
